scenarioDescription:
The TOI-813 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-813 is a star with 1.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.94 times its radius. It is located 858.26 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.73 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-813 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-813 system


TOI-813 b

TOI-813 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.42 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-813 b is 36.252 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-813 b is 6.710 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-813 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-813, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-813 - System With 1 Exoplanet
